text:
Definitely a hidden gem in SG. You will always find new pieces of arts and crafts when you come visit. The owner/curator are ready to happily share the stories and techniques of all these precious and their artists.

A great place to check out with other nice little shops in Pearl Hill with friends!Very easy access with the staircase behind the People‚Äòs Park Complex.

Amazing selection of unique Japanese/Chinese potteryware and glasswares. The owner handpicks each item sold instore and is passionate about its craftsmenship. Shop is a little hard to find though - after going through the main entrance turn right and walk straight.
Small gallery with a selection of cute art pieces. Lots of nice natural lighting. Located in a historical building. Worth a visit.

In a fast-paced city like Singapore, there is a comfortable space where it feels like time has been pressed on the pause button. While chatting with the boss, I was deeply moved by the boss's original intention. At that moment, language was just a supplement, and the flow of love in the soul was the main body.
The tea brewed by the boss's hands full of love and vision, gently holding the teacupüçµThe temperature of the tea is transmitted through the porcelain to the depths of the soul. The faint fragrance of the tea hypnotizes the head. After taking a sip of the warm tea, it enters the stomach, and all the cells in the body are nourished.
The boss firmly believes that integrating art into life can make the spiritual world richer. When you don‚Äôt know where to rest your head, Round & Round can be one of your optionsüß°
